2014-11-29.snippet: Manufacturing and agricultural output dragged on growth in the last quarter, raising pressure on Prime Minister Narendra Modi to expand his economic revival efforts....
2014-11-29.lead_paragraph: Manufacturing and agricultural output dragged on growth in the last quarter, raising pressure on Prime Minister Narendra Modi to expand his economic revival efforts.
2014-11-29.abstract: India's economic growth slowed to 5.3 percent in three months ended in September from year earlier; figures support expectations of delayed recovery.

headline.main: India’s Economic Growth Slows to 5.3%
headline.print_headline: Economic Growth Slows in India

2014-11-29.snippet: Prices in Europe continue to rise at rates so low they pose an economic threat, while high unemployment continues to be a problem....
2014-11-29.lead_paragraph: Prices in Europe continue to rise at rates so low they pose an economic threat, while high unemployment continues to be a problem.
2014-11-29.abstract: Eurozone inflation rate is slipping toward zero, even as job market remains moribund; consumer prices rose just 0.3 percent in November from year earlier, slipping from 0.4 percent increase reported in October.

headline.main: Eurozone Inflation Rate Dips, Stirring Deflation Fears
headline.print_headline: New Deflation Fears in the Eurozone

2014-11-29.snippet: The decision is a sign that the European Commission, the bloc’s executive arm, under Jean-Claude Juncker will be sensitive to calls to ease up on austerity....
2014-11-29.lead_paragraph: The decision is a sign that the European Commission, the bloc’s executive arm, under Jean-Claude Juncker will be sensitive to calls to ease up on austerity.
2014-11-29.abstract: European Union gives Belgium, France and Italy three more months to bring their budgets in line with legal requirements; decision is sign that European Commission under Jean-Claude Juncker will be sensitive to calls to ease up on austerity in Europe.

headline.main: European Union Gives Belgium, France and Italy Time to Comply on Budget Rules
headline.print_headline: E.U. Gives 3 Nations More Time on Budgets

2014-11-30.snippet: Initial weak numbers revived concerns among retailers that, despite improved economic conditions, shoppers remain wary....
2014-11-30.lead_paragraph: Initial weak numbers revived concerns among retailers that, despite improved economic conditions, shoppers remain wary.
2014-11-30.abstract: Initial readings by consumer analytics firm ShopperTrak show that combined sales on Thanksgiving and Black Friday fell 0.5 percent from same period in 2013; report revises concerns among retailers that consumers are still nervous about spending.

headline.main: Black Friday Sales Slip as Discounts Start Earlier
headline.print_headline: Black Friday Sales Slip as Discounts Start Earlier

2014-11-30.snippet: Sony Pictures Entertainment is investigating what provoked the cyberattack, including whether there are any ties to a coming film that has elicited the ire of North Korea....
2014-11-30.lead_paragraph: Sony Pictures Entertainment is investigating what provoked the cyberattack, including whether there are any ties to a coming film that has elicited the ire of North Korea.
2014-11-30.abstract: Sony Pictures Entertainment is investigating what provoked Thanksgiving weekend cyberattack, which led company to shut down several messaging systems; studio is looking to see whether incident is tied to coming release of film The Interview, which has elicited ire of North Korea.

headline.main: Intrusion on Sony Unit Prompts a Shutdown of Messaging Systems
headline.print_headline: Intrusion on Sony Unit Prompts a Shutdown of Messaging Systems

byline.contributor: Nicole Perlroth contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By BROOKS BARNES and MICHAEL CIEPLY

2014-11-30.snippet: To combat declining attendance, movie theaters are experimenting with more immersive and interactive experiences, including moving seats, scents and precipitation....
2014-11-30.lead_paragraph: To combat declining attendance, movie theaters are experimenting with more immersive and interactive experiences, including moving seats, scents and precipitation.
2014-11-30.abstract: Movie theater chains across country are experimenting with additional features in order to combat declining attendance, particularly among younger moviegoers; experiments include undulating seats, scent machines and instant on-screen messaging; ticket revenue in North America has fallen 4 percent in 2013 compared to same period year earlier, and attendance is equally down.

headline.main: To Lure Young, Movie Theaters Shake, Smell and Spritz
headline.print_headline: To Lure Young, Theaters Shake, Smell and Spritz
